page.title: 12FARMING IN THE PAST
page.content: The original industry of the area was farming.Farms were smaller and more numerous.The work was done by the farmer and his family with help from the odd farm labourer. The work was labour intensive.Records in our school log book say "many children were absent from school at harvest time helping on the farm".All farms grew cereals,root crops & greens to feed the animals in winter.They had grass on which animals grazed & some which was cut for hay.All farms had sheep, cows,pigs,horses,ducks,hens,geese & turkeys.Today there are fewer farms but with much larger acreage.These are worked by a much smaller workforce.The work is still labour intensive but, tractors and other machines have made things easier.Today organic manure has been replaced by chemical fertilisers.
